DataElement.preferredName: First Metastatic Tumor Anatomic Site Other Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term not previously mentioned that represents the anatomic site of the first metastatic tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree._A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology._Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.
